revised_title: Foraminifera: A Study of the Genus Orbitolites
tldr: This article explores the structure and development of the Foraminifera, specifically the genus Orbitolites. The author examines the calcareous shells and the soft body made up of sarcode, which is without a digestive cavity or organs. The study focuses on the two types of development, simple and complex, and their variations. The author also discusses the nutrition, growth, and reproduction of these creatures, as well as their relation to other types of structure and their classification in the field of paleontology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
